div.p:
The repository browser allows you to inspect the content of a remote repository. Repository content is displayed as a tree and multiple repositories can be browsed at once (Screenshot 1)
Screenshot 1 Repository Browser

Altho some well known repositories are provided by default, as well as some known primary repo mirrors, you can define new repositories by clicking the 'Add Repository' button (in the ToolBar). This brings up a dialog where you can specify a new repository (Screenshot 2) that will be added to the browser once defined.
Screenshot 2 Repository Browser

section.name: Repository Search
section.p:
Mevenide relies on Mavenzilla (0.1) to search remote repositories. Two views are provided for this : the first one allows you to edit the query (Screenshot 3), whilst the second one displays the result (Screenshot 4).
Screenshot 3 Repository Search Query
Screenshot 4 Repository Search Results
